channel.title: Under The Mason's Apron
channel.itunes:author: Tinker Mal and Planxty Gramster
channel.description:
A monthly-ish podcast featuring folk music old and new for aficionados and the uninitiated alike. From the famous to the obscure, signed or unsigned, live or dead, good or ...erm... whatever.
Join Tinker Mal and Planxty Gramster for an hour of heart-warming songs and tunes and infantile wit. If we like it, we'll play it. Don't say we didn't warn you.
Want to hear your stuff played on the show? We welcome submissions from artists who would like us to play their music; please click on the contacts link for more information.
http://www.masonsapronradio.co.uk
channel.itunes:subtitle: A Regular Folk Music Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: Real Folk for real folk... like you!
channel.itunes:keywords: folk, podcast, radio, traditional, contemporary, instrumental, celtic, comedy

item.title: Under The Mason's Apron #10 Jan 2012
item.itunes:author: Tinker Mal and Planxty Gramster
item.description:
This month we feature an interview with Katriona Gilmore and Jamie Roberts, including tracks from their latest CD; Up From The Deep. Jamie used to be a member of the folk band Kerfuffle, and Katriona is in a newly formed line-up of the Albion Band.

 

Also this month we play old friends Sandwitch and Maria Barham along with a few tracks from recently submitted CDs. Plus, Planxty Gramster has a strange encounter with a young lady when she mistakes his head for a cushion and Tinker Mal hotly denies ownership of a pink and leopard-skin wallet.

 

This month's playlist:

 

1) Tamalin – Skipping Over Bogs www.johnmcsherry.com (from 2009 CD ‘Rhythm and Rhyme’)
2) The Bailey Sisters – My Son John www.baileysisters.co.uk (from 2011 CD ‘After silence, music’)
3) Katriona Gilmore & Jamie Roberts – Nothing At All www.gilmoreroberts.co.uk (from 2010 CD ‘Up From the Deep’)
4) Green Diesel – The Saga of John Ward www.greendieselfolk.com
5) Mawkin - Skymningspolskan-Betsy-Likens www.mawkin.co.uk
6) Katriona Gilmore & Jamie Roberts – Off to California
7) Katriona Gilmore & Jamie Roberts – Punch & Chase
8) Maria Barham – Silver Dagger www.reverbnation.com/mariabarham
9) Callanish – King’s Shilling www.callanishband.com
10) Sandwitch – The Dreadful End www.reverbnation.com/sandwitchfolk
From 2010 CD ‘Going 4th Onto New Horizons’
11) Katriona Gilmore & Jamie Roberts – No Rest for the Wicked (REMIX)
Single released in July 2011; 
12) Flaming June – Nerves of Steel www.flamingjune.co.uk

www.masonsapronradio.co.uk

item.title: Under The Mason's Apron #9 Xmas 2011
item.itunes:author: Tinker Mal and Planxty Gramster
item.description:
We present for your delectation a mysterious Christmas crime mystery play written and produced by, and starring, your genial hosts with co-operation from assorted unfortunate acquaintences. We also play some good music as always.


We would like to take this opportunity to wish all our listeners a very Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year and thank you all for staying with us this far.

 

1) Emily Smith - Winter Song www.emilysmith.org
2) Karen Casey - The Snows That Melt the Soonest www.karencasey.com
CD 'The Winds Begin to Sing' 2001
3) Lisa Knapp - I wish my love was a cherry www.lisaknapp.co.uk
Good video of this on Youtube.
4) Josienne Clarke & Ben Walker - Rain and Snow www.josienneclarke.co.uk
CD 'The Seas are Deep' 2011 
5) Jonathan Day - Canticle www.jonathanday.net
6) Pilgrim’s Way - Magic Christmas Tree www.pilgrims-way.net
Originally written and performed by the Incredible String Band.
7) O’Hooley and Tidow - The Last Polar Bear www.ohooleyandtidow.com
CD 'The Fragile' 2011
8) Pentangle - Let No Man Steal Your Thyme www.pentangle.info
CD 'Early classics' 1992
9) Tinkerscuss - Tongue That Cannot Lie www.reverbnation.com/tinkerscuss
A song by Karine Polwart from HER album 'This Earthly Spell'. A Tinkerscuss' tribute to her phenomenal writing skills.
10) Fine Friday - Cold Blow www.krisdrever.com
Band unfortunately split to concentrate on other projects.
11) Rankin Sisters - Coventry Carol www.therankinfamily.com
Canadian girl trio.
12) Steeleye Span - Unconquered Sun www.peterknight.net
CD 'Winter' 2009

 

www.masonsapronradio.co.uk

item.title: Under The Mason's Apron #8 Dec 2011
item.itunes:author: Tinker Mal and Planxty Gramster
item.description:
This month we will be featuring a Bella Hardy interview and songs, BBC2 Folk Awards 2012 nominee for best original song, plus Jonny Kearney & Lucy Farrell, nominees for best duo, plus Mike Harding, that all-round good egg ( well to some people anyway). The show was put together before the BBC Folk Awards noms were announced - honest.

 

Past winners we will be playing include Nancy Kerr & James Fagan, Ewan McLennan, and one-eleventh of Bellowhead (the best eleventh?). Beggars, pirates, dancers, hares, tramps, security measures, a shoemaker, and an early Christmas put in an appearance.

 

1) Shiznitz - Mason’s Apron  www.soundcloud.com/Shiznitz
2) The Beggar Girls – The Dancer www.myspace.com/beggargirls
3) Nancy Kerr & James Fagan – Locks and Bolts www.kerrfagan.com
4) Bella Hardy – The herring girl www.bellahardy.com
5) Urban Folk Quartet – Upstart/Platform Two www.theurbanfolkquartet.com    
6) Ewan McLennan – Tramps & Hawkers www.ewanmclennan.co.uk
7) Emily Smith – Gala Water www.emilysmith.org
8) Bella Hardy – Flowers of May
9) Bella Hardy – Bridge of dean
10) Jonny Kearney & Lucy Farrell – Hare on the Mountain www.jonnyandlucy.com
11) Blackbeard’s Tea Party – The Belgian Tune www.blackbeardsteaparty.com
12) Bella Hardy – Labyrinth
13) Rachael McShane – My Johnny was a shoemaker www.rachaelmcshane.com
14) Mike Harding – Christmas 1914 www.mikeharding.co.uk

 

www.masonsapronradio.co.uk

item.title: Under The Mason's Apron #7 Nov 2011
item.itunes:author: Tinker Mal and Planxty Gramster
item.description:
This month we bring you the show from a genuine haunted garden shed.  An ectoplasmatic extravaganza of spook-tacular audio stimulation and some music as well. Join Count Tinker Mal Van Helsing and Planxty Von Gramstein on a rediculously terrifying search for Paranormal Inactivity and a cheese and tomato sandwich... Happy Halloween!!!

 

 1) Lothlorien – A-Souling
2) Jo Freya – All things are quite silent www.freyamusic.co.uk
3) Emily Portman – Sirens www.emilyportman.co.uk
4) The Devil’s Interval – Down among the dead men www.myspace.com/thedevilsinterval
5) Emily Barker – Little Deaths www.emily-barker.com
6) Lau – The unquiet grave www.lau-music.co.uk
7) Kate Rusby – I am stretched on your grave www.katerusby.com
8) Grada – Abe’s axe www.gradamusic.com
9) The Demon Barbers – The werewolf www.thedemonbarbers.co.uk
10) Sharon Shannon – The 3 headed monster www.sharonshannon.com
11) Chris While – Van Dieman’s land www.whileandmatthews.co.uk
12) Solas – Darkness, darkness www.solasmusic.com

www.masonsapronradio.co.uk

item.title: Under The Mason's Apron #6 Oct 2011
item.itunes:author: Tinker Mal and Planxty Gramster
item.description:
This month Tinker Mal and Planxty Gramster sail the trecherous high seas of the Bogwater Canal and manage not to steer clear of trouble. They encounter a buxom barmaid, some Colonial visitors, a man in a pub and an irate water feature operative. Oh... and some music was involved too.

 

1) Alex Glasgow – When the boat comes In
2) Arcady – The River Website:  myspace.com/arcady3
3) Tinkerscuss – Banks of Green Willow Website: myspace.com/tinkerscuss
4) A.L. Lloyd – The Bonny Ship the Diamond
5) Damien O’Kane – Banks of the Boyne Website: Damienokane.co.uk
6) John Renbourn Group – Black Waterside
7) Canterach – Shipyards Website: myspace.com/canterach
8) Maddy Prior & June Tabor – The Grey Funnel Line
9) Serundal – Water Dance Website: myspace.com/serundalmusic
10) Mick Moloney – The Boatman’s Dance Website: mickmoloney.com
11) Kate Rusby – Annan Waters Website: katerusby.com
12) Troy Donockley – Wild black Coast Website: troydonockley.co.uk

 

www.masonsapronradio.co.uk
